sentence.text: GATA3, a critical transcription factor involved in the development of the mammary gland, also plays important roles in mammary tumorigenesis by regulating transcription in coordination with two essential DNA repair factors, protein ADP-ribosylation and BRCA1.

However, whether and how negative regulation of mammary gland epithelial cell proliferation participates in the process of DNA repair, which is often associated with tumorigenesis, has not been investigated.

entity.text: negative regulation of mammary gland epithelial cell proliferation

sentence.text: In addition, through data mining analysis, we observed an extremely strong correlation between the expression levels of negative regulation of mammary gland epithelial cell proliferation and CtIP in paratumors, but the correlation turned insignificant in mammary tumors.

entity.text: negative regulation of mammary gland epithelial cell proliferation

sentence.text: Using vectors encoding GATA3 with mutations frequently occurring in mammary tumors, we found that several mutations on GATA3 led to a dysregulation of double-strand break repair via homologous recombination, and therefore HR repair.

entity.text: double-strand break repair via homologous recombination

sentence.text: In summary, our data delineates the regulatory mechanisms of negative regulation of mammary gland epithelial cell proliferation in DNA DSB repair and strongly suggests that it might act as a tumor suppressor by promoting double-strand break repair via homologous recombination expression and HR to stabilize genomes

entity.text: negative regulation of mammary gland epithelial cell proliferation
double-strand break repair via homologous recombination
